PATIENT_ID: TEST_BCVI_001
ARRIVAL_TIME: 2026-02-04 06:00:00

[TRAUMA_HP] 2026-02-04 06:10:00
Category I activation for 42-year-old male. High-speed MVC with rollover.
Blunt trauma mechanism. GCS 8 on arrival. Intubated in field.
Severe facial trauma with midface instability.
Neurologic examination: focal neurologic deficit noted.
Left-sided hemiparesis. Lateralizing deficit present.
Expanding cervical hematoma noted on left.

[NURSING_NOTE] 2026-02-04 06:15:00
Hemodynamically stable post-intubation. BP 110/72, HR 98, RR 14 vent.

[IMAGING] 2026-02-04 06:30:00
CT cervical spine: C2 transverse foramen fracture with subluxation.
CT head: diffuse axonal injury pattern. No midline shift.
Basilar skull fracture involving the carotid canal identified.
CTA neck obtained. CT angiography neck demonstrates Grade II
left internal carotid artery dissection.

[PHYSICIAN_NOTE] 2026-02-04 06:50:00
Neurologic examination findings consistent with BCVI.
Focal deficit inconsistent with head CT findings.
Multiple BCVI risk factors present: basilar skull fracture,
cervical transverse foramen fracture, diffuse axonal injury with GCS < 6 equivalent.
Anticoagulation initiated per BCVI protocol.
